DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no indicator to ask if an individual receiving medical care has an infection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: eligibility criteria concerning the patient's infection status.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an uncontrolled infection?

ReferenceDocuments.description: merged info from CDE with duplicate name (#2006150)

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an uncontrolled viral, bacterial or fungal infection?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Uncontrolled infection

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection or chronic infection requiring chronic suppressive antibiotics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has an infection developed since last visit?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have HIV or any uncontrolled fungal, bacterial, or viral infections?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active infection at initiation of study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Active bacterial or fungal infection. All prior infections must be resolved following optimal therapy.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient suffered from uncontrolled infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient documented with active, uncontrolled infection at the planned time of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known active infection of HBV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known active infection of HCV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active uncontrolled infection as defined in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience any bloodstream infection during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF  Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had signs or symptoms of infection within 14 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection including tuberculosis (clinical evaluation that includes clinical history, physical examination and radiographic findings, and TB testing in line with local practice), hepatitis B (known positive HBV surface antigen (HBsAg) result), hepatitis C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection (excluding skin or toenail infections) requiring systemic antibiotic, antifungal or antiviral therapy within 28 days prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Diagnosis of a rare infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled infection or immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or active hepatitis B or C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an uncontrolled infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text17
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of tuberculosis, active hepatitis B (HBV) or hepatitis C (HCV), or uncontrolled human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known Active or Uncontrolled Infection Requiring Ongoing Antifungals or Antibiotics

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have signs or symptoms of infection within 1 week prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection including tuberculosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Active uncontrolled systemic fungal, bacterial or viral infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ARST2031 Exclusion Infection
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of uncontrolled infections?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled systemic bacterial, viral, or fungal infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient develop infection during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have ongoing or active infection (requiring parental antibiotics)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG-Text-16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient develop viral infection/reactivation with or without end organ disease (i.e., CMV, adenovirus, EBV, HHV-6, BK) requiring hospitalization and/or systemic antiviral therapy and/or cell therapy during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented active, uncontrolled infection at the time of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience viremia with or without end organ disease during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was there evidence of viremia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any uncontrolled fungal, bacterial, viral, or parasitic infections?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have presence of fungal, bacterial, viral, or other infection that is uncontrolled?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of uncontrolled infection?
